problem: How many integers are in the solution set of $|x-2|\leq5.6$ ?
solution: Getting rid of the absolute value, we have $-5.6 \le x-2 \le 5.6$, or $-3.6 \le x \le 7.6$. Thus, $x$ can be any integer from -3 to 7, inclusive. There are $7-(-3)+1=\boxed{11}$ integers in this range.
model_solution:
Step 1: Rewrite the given inequality as a double inequality: $-5.6\leq x-2 \leq 5.6$.
Step 2: Add 2 to all parts of the inequality to get $-3.6\leq x \leq 7.6$.
Step 3: Identify the integers within the range $-3.6\leq x \leq 7.6$, which are -3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7.
Step 4: There are 11 integers in the solution set.
There are 11 integers in the solution set.
The final answer is: $\boxed{11}$
